alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Canadian (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 8:52AM CDT until July 12 at 1:28AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Watonga affecting Canadian and Blaine Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Watonga. * WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding of croplands...pastures... and rural roads occurs. The floodwaters extend from near Watonga in Blaine County... downstream to near Calumet in western Canadian County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 14.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 15.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM CDT.
